pageContext.claim: “You know, John Kerry speaks to them [Iran] a lot. John Kerry tells them not to call. That's a violation of the Logan Act. And, frankly, he should be prosecuted on that. …He's talking to Iran and has been. Has many meetings and many phone calls, and he's telling them what to do. That is a total violation of the Logan Act.”
pageContext.analysis: Kerry, the former secretary of state, said he had one conversation with the Iranian foreign minister in Germany after Trump withdrew the United States from the Iran nuclear deal. He denied any inappropriate contacts.
